newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan March crude steel output up 9.5 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan March crude steel output up 9.5 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Japan's crude steel output rose 9.5 percent in March from a year earlier to 8.91 million tonnes, the Japan Iron and Steel Federation said on Tuesday.
The March figure was up 7.6 percent from February, the industry group said in a statement.
Japan's crude steel output in the year to March 31, 1997, was up 0.8 percent from the previous year to 100.81 million tonnes, the federation said.
March output of tin plate was 128,700 tonnes, down 5.7 percent year-on-year and up 4.1 percent month-on-month, the federation said.
Production of galvanised steel sheet in March was 1.15 million tonnes, up 16.6 percent year-on-year and up 14.0 percent month-on-month, it said.
Japan's 1996/97 tin plate output was 1.56 million tonnes, down 6.1 percent from 1995/96 and its 1996/97 galvanised steel sheet output was 11.74 million tonnes, up 1.6 percent from 1995/96.
